original_title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Mangin Street
text:
(1)
509-501 East Houston Street, at, adjoining, and west of the S.W. corner of Mangin Street. This is a 3-story house with a stucco front.
1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York. Negative No. 382.

(2)
The same.
March 29, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

original_title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Stanton Street
text:
East River Drive, west side, between Stanton and East Houston Streets, showing the demolition of the Rubel Ice Plant. For further views of this area see Tompkins Street.

August 7, 1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

original_title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Houston Street (East)
text:
East River Drive, at the foot of East Houston Street. In the background is the river and the dim outline of the Williamsburg Bridge.

September 3, 1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

original_title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Mangin Street
text:
East Houston Street (left), at the S.F. corner of Mangin Street, showing a clearance, and the rear of a warehouse facing on Tompkins Street. Also shown (background) are the suspension towers of the Williamsburg Bridge.

June 4, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

original_title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Houston Street (East)
text:
East River Drive, at East Houston Street, showing heaps of building material to be used as a fill at the waters edge. This view is northward from the Williamsburg Bridge and shows the Brooklyn and Queens shore, across the East River. Nos. 2 and 3 of this set show a close up of stone and shale that compose the piles seen in the foreground of No. 1.

June 25, 1937.
Views 2 & 3:--June 4, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

original_title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Houston Street (East)
Manhattan: East River Drive - Houston Street (East)
Manhattan: East River Drive - Houston Street (East)
Manhattan: East River Drive - Houston Street (East)
text:
East River Drive, north from East Houston (left) to 14th Streets, as seen from the Williamsburg Bridge. Note the razing of piers and the piles of material that will be used for filling purposes. This is a set of 3 views.

June 25, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

830-D3

original_title: Manhattan: East River Drive - Houston Street (East)
text:
East River Drive, east side, at the foot of East Houston Street, showing piles of material that will be used as a fill on the rivers edge. This is a set of 2 views photographed in a northward direction.

June 4, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, from a slightly different angle.

June 4th, 1937

P. L. Sperr,

original_title: Manhattan: East River Drive - 5th Street (East)
text:
(1) East River Drive from E.5th Street showing N.W. corner in foreground. Note the gas holders and smoke stacks of the former New York Mutual Gas Company, now the Consolidated Edison Company, between E.11th and E.14th Streets. This new thoroughfare will skirt same at the waters edge and continue Northward to 17th Street, where it will bend Eastward to continue up to the present Exterior Street.

June 29th, 1938

(2) East River Drive West Side and Northwards across Houston Street.

May 12th, 1939

(3) The same, from a point farther North.

May 12th, 1939

Photographs,
P.L. Sperr,

original_title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East - Mangin Street
text:
East Houston Street at the end of Mangin Street and looking westwards.
P.L.Sperr,

May 12th, 1939.

original_title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - East River Drive
text:
516 East Houston Street, north side, west of the East River Drive, showing tenement conditions on the East Side of Manhattan.

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
